intro: Trigonella cylindracea, commonly known as the cylindrical fenugreek, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with small, trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and are similar in some properties to those of the common fenugreek. The botanical features of Trigonella cylindracea make it an important species for ecological and agricultural studies in its native habitat.
